conversation.content: [anxious] This isn't what I came here for. We had signs, we had chants, we had— we had a plan. [shaky voice] But now people are throwing things and I can't get out. The crowd's pushing forward and I'm just, um... I'm trapped in the middle of it. [whispering] Someone just handed me a brick. They actually put it in my hand. I dropped it immediately but what if someone saw? What if they think I'm— [fast] I keep trying to move backwards but there's nowhere to go. Everyone behind me is pushing forward and the people in front are getting angrier and I don't want this. [upset] This was supposed to be about justice, about making our voices heard, not... not this. [pause] My mom told me to be careful. She said "stay on the edges, baby, so you can leave if things go bad." But I wanted to be part of it, you know? Really part of it. And now I'm, um... [crying while speaking] I can hear glass breaking. Police sirens getting closer. Someone's yelling "run" but I can't move, I literally cannot move. This isn't protest anymore, this is something else entirely and I'm scared.

subject: Being forced to participate as a rioter when you just wanted peaceful protest
